claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.
explanation: Two schematic diagrams comparing native influenza hemagglutinin (HA) structure (panel a) with recombinant HA0 used in Flublok (panel b). Each shows the globular head and fibrous stem, glycosylation patterns (polysialylated complex glycans vs paucimannose glycans), cleavage status of the fusion peptide, and disulfide bonds. The figure presents structural and glycosylation differences between native viral HA and recombinant HA0 but contains no data on antigen content or dose. Therefore, it does not support the claim about Flublok having 3× the HA antigen content of standard-dose vaccines. Note: Image is clear and legible; limitation is that only structural information is shown, with no quantitative dosage or immunogenicity data.
